steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6apte","text":"Grow Arabidopsis thaliana ecotype Columbia plants in a 150 mL plastic cup with aerated, moist, fertilized and autoclaved soil in an environmentally controlled chamber with a medium photoperiod (12 h light/12 h dark at  ) under low light (optimum light is approximately 150 µE.m-2.s-1) and 50-60% relative humidity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":218,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4n46j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4rl4j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfikg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"22","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"95l2u","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Pierce the base of the plastic cup to drain excess water and prevent root rot.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f8jk8","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Always maintain seedling production. Remember to transplant new plants every 2 weeks to ensure that the experiments can be repeated. Label each batch of plants properly.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4hvh9","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Due to laboratory logistics, we used a photoperiod of 12 h light/12 h dark, but the recommended photoperiod condition to optimize the production of the plant's vegetative area is 8 h light/16 h dark. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"enma5","text":"? TROUBLESHOOTING","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"178B46A1F317437282436D05E3168CE7"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aq7i4","text":"Choose two to four healthy plants and take 20 leaves (3-4 cm long) by cutting each petiole vertically with the help of a scalpel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o3qe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cq8md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2bh9f","text":"! CAUTION Scalpel blade is sharp: use it with extreme caution.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ct6e9","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Leaf selection will directly impact protoplast production. Watch the development of the plant aerial part.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6s7fc","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Place the leaves immediately in a 100 mL beaker with 50 mL of sterile distilled water. This step is necessary to I) prevent the formation of air bubbles in the leaf, which could hamper the infiltration of the enzyme solution, and II) wash away any remnants of soil and dust from the leaves.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"07F34237B97F42F79D3AC3EB3C6EDAB0"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t3el","text":"(Optional) Sterilize the leaves by washing once in 70% ethanol, for   in a 1% sodium hypochlorite solution, and five times in sterile dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":136,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26sis","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dafel","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs8ta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a8vch","text":"! CAUTION Sodium hypochlorite is hazardous: wear proper personal protective equipment (PPE).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"CE959AB182C3420E8ABA2536CB1A9B28"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4k1","text":"Using a metal tweezer, transfer one leaf with the adaxial side facing upward to a glass cell culture dish (90 mm x 15 mm) containing 25 mL of the W5 solution. Using the scalpel, extract and discard the remaining petiole and make sequential cross-sections (1-2 mm thick) from the midrib to the leaf margin. It is not necessary to cut the leaves completely, only to make little “scratches” on the leaf surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oqr8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"drv6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnuj7","text":"! CAUTION Scalpel blade is sharp, use it with extreme caution.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3r70u","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Leaf cuts are made in W5 solution to prevent air bubble formation in the leaf, which could hamper the infiltration of the enzyme solution, thus influencing the achievement of a satisfactory number of viable protoplasts.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"1127C6F09DA24916936EA9F47D683A48"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2adi","text":"Using a metal tweezer, carefully pass the chopped leaf on the cell culture dish´s edge to remove excess W5 solution and transfer the leaf with the adaxial side down to another glass cell culture dish (60 mm x 15 mm) containing 5 mL of the enzyme solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7sfb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpv8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"jf25","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Repeat steps 3 and 4 one leaf at a time.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aj65b","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Place the aliquot of stock enzyme solution on ice to thaw slowly before use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"C0D5FF02FF834FC9BE6C918046E7E5CC"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5em","text":"Transfer the cell culture dish with the enzyme solution and chopped leaves into the vacuum chamber and vacuum infiltrate 3 times for approximately   under 500 mm Hg pump pressure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"954bg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai861","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab2dk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"as59r","text":"! CAUTION With each vacuum repetition, release the vacuum very carefully.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b4t74","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Vacuum is essential for enzyme solution leaf infiltration. Vacuum until air bubbles emerge from the leaves.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"6E7AC5B63D2A4D6284E546A895AC96C6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2oco5","text":"Cover the cell culture dish with aluminum foil and then incubate in the platform shaker with gentle swirling (up to 40 rpm) for   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":128,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":133,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6rkv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e31g1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frf3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4osmi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8g1en","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Digestion should be performed in the dark to prevent oxidation and to reduce the photosynthetic pathway.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"E778BF11D89443D9867206A694DD7705"}}}}
